subject: History
title: Germ Theory Changes Everything
description: A fast breakdown of Germ Theory Changes Everything for builders.

hook.text: Until the 1860s, most doctors thought disease came from bad smells. Pasteur proved tiny organisms were the real killers.

buildup.text: Pasteur showed that fermentation and spoilage were caused by microorganismsâ€”not spontaneous generation.

discovery.text: Robert Koch went further, linking specific bacteria to specific diseases: anthrax, tuberculosis, cholera.

twist.text: Doctors initially resisted. Ignaz Semmelweis proved handwashing saved lives in 1847â€”and was committed to an asylum.

climax.text: Germ theory gave us vaccines, antibiotics, antiseptics, and pasteurization. Modern medicine rests on this one idea.

punchline.text: The man who proved handwashing works died in an asylum.

quiz.question: What happened to Ignaz Semmelweis after proving handwashing prevents infections?
options: He won a Nobel Prize for his discovery
He was committed to an asylum by colleagues who rejected his ideas
He became head of surgery at Vienna's hospital
